title: Angeline 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: Substantial fruit flavors and good structure highlight this medium- to full-bodied, concentrated wine. It has a straightforward, no-nonsense approach and offers great value. Enticing black cherry and raspberry flavors are supported by fine-grained tannins and crisp acidity. The fruit notes are pure, clean and linger nicely on the finish.

title: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2016 Terre Roses  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: A blend from several small parcels, this wine has richness and structure. It is dense, packed with firm tannins as well as juicy black-cherry flavors. This firm wine will age. Drink from 2019.

title: Eredi Enzo Raspi 2014 Bandini Villa Pomona  (Chianti Classico)
description: Lovely scents of forest berry, new leather, Mediterranean herb and a whiff of pipe tobacco take shape in the glass. It's racy and elegant, offering crushed strawberry, red cherry and star anise set against a backbone of firm acidity and taut, refined tannins. Drink 2020–2029.

title: Flanagan 2015 Platt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Low yields from a cool vintage make for a delicate nuanced experience in the glass in this perfumed velvety wine. Plum and cherry flavors are crisp and tart, with the acidity persistent. White pepper and ocean spray contribute context and complexity.

title: Heitz 2013 Ink Grade Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a puckering sensibility of tannin on entry but settles in the glass to show a fresh core of strawberry, black cherry, cedar and soy. The oak is buttery and spicy, good at playing a supporting role to the density of mountain-grown high-toned fruit.

title: Jean Loron 2016 Xavier et Nicolas Barbet Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: This is a ripe and smooth wine. With firm tannins cushioned by rich black fruits, it is spicy, smoky and will age. The wine, from the personal property of the Barbet family that also runs négociant Jean Loron, will be ready to drink from mid-2018.
designation: Xavier et Nicolas Barbet Vieilles Vignes

title: Josef Bauer 2015 Bella Viktoria Red (Wagram)
description: Black cherry and elderberry create a brooding impression of fruit. The palate adds freshness and spicy charm. There is a lovely contrast between plump juiciness and vivid tartness that adds a little drama to the palate. The tannins give way to a fine crunch on this medium, fruit-driven body. The finish is dry and moreish.

title: Longboard 2014 Dakine Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral aromatics are the star of the show in this full-bodied, densely packed wine, blended with 2% each of Grenache, Petite Sirah, Malbec, Zinfandel and Carignane. Tart in acidity, it's juicy and bright, with a persistence of black raspberry.

title: Noceto 2013 OGP The Original Grandpère Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This wine, from a vineyard first planted in the 1860s, has good balance an a distinctive flavor profile, as meaty earthy nuances vie for attention with delicious plummy flavors and a broad, rather soft texture. Full body gives the wine a little grip on the palate in lieu of heavy tannins.

title: Ogier 2016 Artesis White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Waxy blossoms, lemon peels and gooseberries perfume this zesty, dry white. Fresh grapefruit and lemon flavors are cutting and pristine, lingering on a revitalizing mineral tone. Drink now through 2020.

title: Querceto di Castellina 2015 L'Aura  (Chianti Classico)
description: Earthy aromas of sunbaked soil, new leather, overripe plum and a whiff of game come together on this. The chewy, savory palate doles out fleshy black cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and star anise framed in lithe tannins. It's already hit its ideal drinking window so enjoy soon.

title: Rasi 2016 It Was One of Those Rare LA Days Where There Happened to Be a Thunder Storm. Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rachel Silkowski works for winemaker Brian Loring, and his ripe and rich style is certainly apparent in this bottling with an incredibly long name. Dried alpine strawberry meets with mace and allspice on the nose, while the palate packs tarragon-laced boysenberry flavors alongside shaved licorice and allspice.
designation: It Was One of Those Rare LA Days Where There Happened to Be a Thunder Storm.

title: Rattalino 2010 Quarantacinque 45 Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Truffle, moist soil, ground clove leather and balsamic aromas emerge on this along with an earthy whiff of game. The smooth, ripe palate doles out fleshy black cherry, prune, licorice and cured meat alongside polished, velvety tannins. It's already hitting its ideal drinking window so drink sooner rather than later.

title: Rémy Ferbras 2015 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Whiffs of leather and barnyard lend earthen complexities to bright blackberry and cherry on this elegant wine. Medium bodied and taut, it finishes long, with a bite of bitter nut skin and bold yet integrated tannins.

title: Shannon 2014 Home Ranch Reserve Tempranillo (Lake County)
description: Full bodied and full flavored, this complex wine smells like black olive, wood smoke and tobacco, tastes like blackberry and dried herbs and feels broad and firmly tannic on the palate. It's built to age well, and should show even more nuances after 2020.

title: Steindorfer 2015 Reserve Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Smoky mocha hints precede notes of aromatic black cherry. The smooth and lush ripeness of the fruit only becomes apparent on the rich, almost luscious palate. The body is smooth and rounded, pliable and plush. The tannins are present but soft, it is ripe black cherry fruit that reigns supreme. Lovely freshness on the finish makes for a bright, long aftertaste.

title: Tenuta San Guido 2015 Le Difese Red (Toscana)
description: Made with 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Sangiovese, this boasts inviting aromas of blue flower, cedar and red-skinned berry. The bright palate doles out juicy Marasca cherry, red raspberry, a hint of mocha and star anise alongside silky, polished tannins.

title: Thacher 2014 Solo Concert Coast View Vineyard Syrah (Monterey)
description: Dense vanilla and baking spice aromas decorate the dried plum and purple-flower aromas on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from the eastern mountains above the Salinas Valley. Black plum sauce, peppercorns and dark chocolate flavors show on the sip, which is quite heavy and dense but expertly structured to stand the test of time.

title: Velvet Bee 2013 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This blend of grapes from Rita's Crown and Radian vineyards delivers a unique nose of wet wood, lemon verbena, macadamia nut and nectarine cream. The mouthfeel is zippy and the backbone is quite chalky, carrying flavors of poached Asian pear, sea salt and lemon zest, with touches of pecan and browned butter.

title: Viña Aquitania 2015 Lazuli Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This Maipo Cabernet is spicy and dry on the nose as opposed to bursting with ripeness. A dry tightly wound palate defines the word firm, while slightly rustic Old World flavors of mixed spices, dried red fruits and oak finish with structure. This is the type of Cab that will benefit from further aging. Drink through 2026.

title: Vistalago 2014 Mezcla Tinta Red (Maule Valley)
description: Earthy black-fruit aromas open wild and give this blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Syrah some teeth. A fleshy fully stacked palate shows structure and tight tannins. Spicy blackberry flavors benefit from integrated oak, while chocolate and residual spice flavors make for a dark finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Weixelbaum 2016 Wahre Werte Gaisberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: Highly appetizing notes of Mirabelle and fresh green pear dominate the nose of this wine. The palate is lithe and slender, with a citrus focus, a yeasty, savory midpalate texture and a moreish, salty finish.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Strong spice aromas and ripe, bold fruit flavors make this a powerful, extroverted wine with a lot of flavor impact. It seems to represent a style shift at Williams Selyem. Nutmeg, ginger and clove leap from the glass and laser-focused black-cherry flavors fill the palate, supported by firm tannins and acidity. Best after 2021.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Templeton Gap District)
description: Black currant, elderberry, charred beef, dried violets and cedar show on the nose of this dark, complex bottling. The energized sip delivers tart black plum before offering more elegant and woody flavors of sandalwood and myrrh, with leathery tannins and savory meat flavors throughout.

title: Hillersden 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Earthy notes of mushroom, white pepper, dried leaves and buttered cannellini beans lead over aromas of lemon and stone fruit. The palate boasts mouth-watering acidity yet not without weight and texture, thanks to time maturing on lees.

title: Boudreaux Cellars 2011 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)
description: Hailing from one of the coolest vintages the state has ever seen, the aromas bring brooding notes of cherry cola, raspberry, dried leaf, wood and cigar box. The flavors are light, tart and focused, maintaining a sense of freshness. It's a lovely offering from this challenging year.

title: Château Thivin 2016  Côte de Brouilly
description: This estate is the most famous and influential in Côte de Brouilly. This wine, from 50-year-old vines, is rich and structured while also having delicious ripe berry and black-cherry fruits. It is likely to age well over the next few months, being ready to drink from mid-2018.

title: Clos LaChance 2015 Estate Vineyard Proprietary Red (Central Coast)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling shows deep blackberry and black currant aromas alongside baked goods and a touch of violets. There is impressive density to the palate, where black plum flavors blend with lavender and baking spice on the finish. The tannins are still quite firm.

title: Collin-Bourisset 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)
description: This wine displays the typical mineral texture associated with this vineyard of granite and schist soils. The texture is given further strength by tannins that suggest the wine needs to age. There is plenty of black fruit as well, so this wine will be best from 2019.

title: David Frost 2015 Par Excellence Cape Blend Red (Western Cape)
description: This Pinotage-based blend, with 15% Shiraz and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, is dark and brooding in the glass. Initial aromas of rich, ripe black berries and cherry sets the stage for the bold, concentrated palate, with notes of char, espresso, licorice root and earthy spice throughout. Medium-plus in weight, with robust and gripping tannins, this firmly structured pour shows great power and length. Drink 2020–2025.
